headline: Russia decree opens door for Exxon return to Sakhalin-1 project
summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday signed a decree that could allow foreign investors, including top U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil, to regain shares in the Sakhalin-1 oil and gas project.  The signing of the decree comes on the day Russian president Vladimir Putin meets Donald Trump in Alaska for a summit where opportunities for investment and business collaboration will be on the agenda, alongside talks to find peace in Ukraine.  Friday's decree was published as a follow-up to one Putin signed in October 2022, which ordered the seizure of the Sakhalin-1 project.

headline: Algeria Close to Signing Shale Gas Deals with Exxon and Chevron
summary: Algeria is nearing final agreements with Exxon and Chevron to explore and invest in its shale gas resources, aiming to significantly boost its gas pipeline and LNG exports.

raw.headline: Algeria Close to Signing Shale Gas Deals with Exxon and Chevron
raw.summary: Algeria is nearing final agreements with Exxon and Chevron to explore and invest in its shale gas resources, aiming to significantly boost its gas pipeline and LNG exports.

headline: Petrobras Gets Regulatory Clearance for Offshore Amazon Drilling
summary: PBR receives Ibama's approval to start emergency response drills in the Foz do Amazonas basin, advancing its push into Brazil's next major offshore oil region.
